item.title: Wedding needs redoing asap please?, 10th October

item.title: Abandoned supermarket cart with rubbish in, 10th October
item.description:
A Morrisons supermarket trolley with a couple of items of rubbish in it have been abandoned next to a public amenity bench and a (very badly cared for) public noticeboard on the corner where Oglander Road joins Grove Vale. This will discourage people from using the bench and create a culture where more items will be abandoned in this public space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Grove Vale, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Athelstan Gardens bin shed, 10th October
item.description:
Large builders bag filled with bush cuttings, all three of our communal bins are also filled with tree and bush cuttings. Kimberly court workmen have dumped it all here, on Tuesday afternoon, they cut the bushes and a tree in Kimberly court and disposed of the waste in Athelstan gardens communal bins. Kimberly court is a private estate that backs onto our council estate. The flat on the corner is having the work done.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kimberley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
